cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 30 miles NW of Great Inagua Island, southeastern Bahamas
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest across the Bahamas, then forecast to skirt or parallel the east coast of Florida before turning north-northwest toward the U.S. Southeast coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just offshore of the southeast Florida coast (Palm Beach–Brevard counties)

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of Florida from Ocean Reef to Sebastian Inlet, including Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warnings in the central and northwestern Bahamas (none yet for Florida)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida east coast, Bahamas, and U.S. East Coast northward through the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with occasional hurricane-force gusts possible Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Coastal inundation of 2–4 ft above normally dry ground possible along Palm Beach County beaches and intracoastal areas during high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated pockets up to 6 inches could cause urban and low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands
